answers.answer:
New arrivals in Brașov seeking general help and integration can find support through the Integration Center for Migrants Brașov, the CATTIA Community Center, and a dedicated support program for accommodation, meals, and integration. Additionally, public libraries offer Romanian language courses to aid integration.

To find detailed information, please refer to the provided text. You can find general help contacts under 'Important contacts', information about the 'CATTIA Community Center', and details about 'The support program for accommodation, meals and integration in Brașov'. For language courses, look under 'Education' and 'Organisations offering their support' for public libraries.
answers.bResponse:
New arrivals in Brașov seeking general help and integration can find support through the Integration Center for Migrants Brașov, the CATTIA Community Center, and a dedicated support program for accommodation, meals, and integration. Additionally, public libraries offer Romanian language courses to aid integration.

To find detailed information, please refer to the provided text. You can find general help contacts under 'Important contacts', information about the 'CATTIA Community Center', and details about 'The support program for accommodation, meals and integration in Brașov'. For language courses, look under 'Education' and 'Organisations offering their support' for public libraries. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-brasov

answers.answer:
The emergency call number in Brașov is 112. For anti-traffic hotlines in Romania, you can call 0800 800 678 or 021 313 3100.

To find more detailed information, please visit the `dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-brasov` website and look under sections like "Important contacts" or "Emergency call number".

answers.answer:
The CATTIA Community Center is located at strada Institutului, nr.35 in Brașov. It operates around the clock, providing information, food, transport to accommodation, counseling, assistance, various workshops, MHPSS support, and hosts offices for UNHCR and World Vision representatives who organize educational projects for children and adults.

To find detailed information, you should go to the webpage from which this summary was extracted and look under the sections "CATTIA Community Center" and "Organisations offering their support".

To find detailed information, you should go to the webpage from which this summary was extracted and look under the sections "CATTIA Community Center" and "Organisations offering their support". For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-brasov

Organizations offering psychological support in Brașov include Swiss Solidarity, Terre des hommes Foundation, World Vision Romania (in Russian and Ukrainian), the International Organization for Migration (in Russian, Ukrainian, Romanian, and English), Plan International Organization, Red Cross Romania (in Russian, Ukrainian, Romanian, and English), the AMURTEL team, and the Agapedia organization.

To find detailed information, navigate to the "Psychological support" section within the webpage or document you are viewing.

To schedule an individual psychological consultation in Brașov, you must complete the form provided by Swiss Solidarity, in collaboration with the Center for the Integration of Migrants.

To find this detailed information, locate the "Psychological support" section in the provided text. Under "Swiss Solidarity", you will find the instruction to complete a form for booking an individual consultation.

Ukrainian preschoolers and pupils can enroll in educational units in Brașov County by submitting applications physically at the Brașov County School Inspectorate (Shirul Gheorghe Dima no. 4) or online to info@isjbrasov.ro. Application forms are available in Romanian, English, and Ukrainian.

To find this detailed information, you would go to the relevant webpage (likely the Brașov section of dopomoha.ro) and read under the "Education" section.

Women can find support for reproductive health, navigating the health system, or domestic violence services through the Women's Center. Additionally, the Agapedia organization provides medical consultations on family planning through its "Safe Space for Women" project.

To find more detailed information, go to the `dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-brasov` webpage. Look for the "Women's Center" section and click the provided link for services dedicated to victims of domestic violence, reproductive health, and navigating the health system. For information on Agapedia, locate the "Organisations offering their support" section on the same page.

For people living with HIV in Romania who need free, anonymous, and confidential psycho-medical-social services, support is available from specialist doctors at 10 Regional HIV Centers across the country, along with the expertise and support of Sens Pozitiv.

To find more detailed information, please visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-brasov and look for the section titled "Counseling for people living with HIV".
